EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT IS CORRELATED WITH FAMILY INCOME AND THE PERCENTAGE OF PEOPLE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL (DATA NOT SHOWN; US CENSUS BUREAU 2000). IN FACT, AMONGST HISPANIC STUDENTS IN TEXAS, 63% OF EARLY COLLEGE STUDENTS ARE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, AND 74% ARE FIRST-GENERATION COLLEGE GOERS. THE POSSIBILITY OF ADVANCING STUDENTS TO HIGHER DEGREES OF EDUCATION IS AN INVESTMENT THAT WILL PAY OFF NOT ONLY FOR THE STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES BUT ALSO FOR THE STATE OF TEXAS AND US. INDIVIDUALS WITH HIGHER LEVELS OF EDUCATION EARN MORE AND ARE MORE LIKELY THAN OTHERS TO BE EMPLOYED. COMPARED TO A HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATE, THE MEDIAN FOUR-YEAR COLLEGE GRADUATE WHO ENROLLS AT AGE 18 AND GRADUATES IN FOUR YEARS CAN EXPECT TO EARN ENOUGH BY AGE 36 TO COMPENSATE FOR BEING OUT OF THE LABOR FORCE FOR FOUR YEARS, AS WELL AS FOR BORROWING THE FULL AMOUNT REQUIRED TO PAY TUITION AND FEES WITHOUT ANY GRANT ASSISTANCE (BAUM ET AL., 2013). PEOPLE WITH ASSOCIATE DEGREES (TWO-YEAR COLLEGE) EARNS ABOUT72% LESS THAT PEOPLE WITH BS DEGREES (FOUR-YEAR COLLEGE) AND ARE MORE PRONE FOR UNEMPLOYMENT.LOWER-INCOME STUDENTS, WHO COME FROM FAMILIES WITH INCOMES LESS THAN $29,600, ARE OVERREPRESENTED IN THE TWO-YEAR FOR-PROFIT AND PUBLIC SECTORS, BUT UNDERREPRESENTED IN FOUR-YEAR PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS. AMONG DEPENDENT STUDENTS FROM THE HIGHEST FAMILY INCOME, 65% ATTENDED FOUR-YEAR PUBLIC OR PRIVATE NONPROFIT COLLEGES. IT IS CLEAR THAT THE TWO-YEAR COLLEGE, BECAUSE OF THE LOWEST TUITION, IS VERY ATTRACTIVE FOR UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS, AND THIS FACT OFFERS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY FOR FOUR-YEAR INSTITUTION TO RECRUIT THESE STUDENTS AND PROGRESS THEM TO BACHELOR'S DEGREES AND BEYOND , WHICH WILL DIRECTLY CHANGE THEIR FUTURE IN TERMS OF EARNING AND LIFESTYLE. THE LRGV IS POPULATED MAINLY BY UNDERREPRESENTED HISPANIC FAMILIES, WHICH JUSTIFY THE FACT THAT ALL 2-YEAR COLLEGES ARE BOOMING WITH RECORD NUMBER OF STUDENTS ENROLLED EACH YEAR; SO THIS PROJECT WILL OFFER STUDENTS NOT ONLY THE OPPORTUNITY TO TRANSITION FROM2-YEAR COLLEGE TO 4-YEAR UNIVERSITY BUT ALSO TO OBTAIN ADDITIONAL SKILLS THROUGH SUMMER UNDERGRADUATE RESEARCH WHICH WILL BETTER PREPARED THEM FOR THE JOB MARKET BUT ALSO SPARK ON THEM THE DESIRE TO CONTINUE THEIR EDUCATION THROUGH MS DEGREES. THIS WILL DIRECT AFFECT NOT ONLY THE LOCAL COMMUNITY BUT ALSO THE STATE OF TEXAS AND THE NATION.THIS PROJECT RESPONDS TO THE PRESSING NEEDS OF IMPROVING RECRUITMENT IN AGRICULTURAL CAREERS AND EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT OF AN UNDERSERVED POPULATION OF HISPANIC STUDENTS FROM SOUTH TEXAS. SOUTH TEXAS IS AN EXTENSIVE REGION WITH PREDOMINANTLY HISPANIC POPULATION (94%) WITH MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOME 14% LOWER THAN THE TEXAS AVERAGE. WHEN ANALYZING ALL ETHNICAL GROUPS SEPARATED, SOUTH TEXAS OUTPERFORMS THE STATE AVERAGE IN EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT, BUT BECAUSE OF THE HISPANIC POPULATION IS LARGE, THE REGION AS A WHOLE UNDERPERFORMS. SOUTH TEXAS'S FOUR-YEAR UNIVERSITIES UNDERPERFORM STATE AVERAGE GRADUATION RATE, WHILE HALF OF THE REGION'S TWO-YEAR COLLEGES EXCEED IT. THIS OFFERS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY TO STREAMLINE LINKS BETWEEN TWO-YEAR AND FOUR-YEAR UNIVERSITIES.BASED ON 2008 DATA FROM THE FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION INFORMATION SYSTEM (FAEIS), ENROLLMENT OF HISPANICS IN AGRICULTURAL RELATED FIELDS IN US CONSTITUTES ONLY 4.5% OF THE STUDENTS. THE FACT THAT THIS PROJECT WILL BE COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE TEXAS STATE TECHNICAL COLLEGE (TSTC), AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE DEPARTMENT, AND TAMUK, WILL CONTRIBUTE IN INCREASING THE NUMBERS OF HISPANIC OBTAINING A FOUR-YEAR COLLEGE EDUCATION IN AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES AND INCREASE EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT ACROSS THIS SO NEEDED AREA. FURTHERMORE, IT BRIDGES TO A LOCAL USDA AGENCY (APHIS) THROUGH INTERNSHIPS.THE LOWER RIO GRANDE VALLEY IN SOUTH TEXAS IS A VERY UNIQUE AREA HOUSING MORE THAN 1.2 MILLION PEOPLE WITH MORE THAN 90% BEING HISPANICS. HISPANICS ARE ATTACHED TO THEIR CULTURE, AND YOUNG PEOPLE ARE RELUCTANT TO LEAVE THE AREA. BECAUSE OF THE STRONG FAMILY BOND, THEY PREFER TO BUILD THEIR LIVES AMONG PEOPLE WHO ARE CLOSE TO THEM. THE MAJORITY OF FAMILIES ARE IN THE LOWEST INCOME BRACKET COMPARED TO THE NATION AND OTHER PARTS OF THE STATE, WHICH MAKES MANY STUDENTS DROP OUT OF HIGH SCHOOL TO WORK AND HELP THEIR FAMILIES. THE FAMILIES ALSO MANY TIMES DO NOT UNDERSTAND THE VALUE OF EDUCATION IN TERMS OF INVESTMENT TO INCREASE THEIR FUTURE INCOME; SO MANY STUDENTS ARE ENCOURAGED BY THEIR FAMILIES TO LOOK FOR A JOB AFTER HIGH SCHOOL. THE TEXAS STATE TECHNICAL COLLEGE (TSTC) IS ONE OF THE BEST 2-YEAR COLLEGES IN TEXAS AND THE HARLINGEN BRANCH IS JUST 20 MIN FROM THE TEXAS A&M UNIVERSITY KINGSVILLE (TAMUK) CITRUS CENTER, A HIGH TECH RESEARCH FACILITY IN SOUTH TEXAS, AND JUST 1 &FRAC12; H FROM TAMUK. FURTHERMORE, THE CITRUS CENTER PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE LOCAL CITRUS INDUSTRY, WHERE ONE OF THE LARGEST PRIVATE AGRICULTURAL COMPANY (WONDERFUL CITRUS) IS LOCATED. THIS COMPANY HIRES SEVERAL OF OUR GRADUATES. ALSO, IN CLOSE PROXIMITY WE HAVE THE USDA ANIMAL AND PLANT HEALTH INSPECTION SERVICE (APHIS). THE STRATEGICALLY LOCATION OF THESE STATE, FEDERAL AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS AT THE VERY CENTER OF SOUTH TEXAS OFFERS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY TO OFFER LOCAL STUDENTS THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING THEY NEED TO IMPROVE THEIR FUTURE. THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT THIS PROJECT WILL DO.THIS PROJECT WILL RECRUIT UNDERREPRESENTED AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE MAJOR STUDENTS FROM A TWO-YEAR TECHNICAL COLLEGE FROM SOUTH TEXAS (TSTC)), TO BACHELOR'S DEGREES IN AGRICULTURE AT TAMUK. PAID SUMMER INTERNSHIPS WILL BE PROVIDED FOR THE STUDENTS WHILE THEY ARE STILL AT TSTC AND WHEN THEY TRANSFER TO TAMUK TO MAINTAIN THEM INTERESTED IN RESEARCH, FACILITATE RECRUITMENT, AND TO TEACH THEM ABOUT THE HIGH TECH AGRICULTURE OF TODAY. TO ENHANCE THEIR SKILLS, INTERNSHIP AT THE WONDERFUL CITRUS LLC WILL BE PROVIDED SO THAT THEY CAN LEARN AGRICULTURE ALSO BY DOING THE JOB. THIS MAY ALSO PRIDE THEIR FUTURE JOB IN A PRIVATE AGRICULTURE ENTERPRISE. MOREOVER, STUDENTS WILL ALSO RECEIVE INTERNSHIP AT APHIS, WHICH IS A VERY GOOD OPPORTUNITY FOR THEM TO LEARN OF HOW THIS FEDERAL ORGANIZATION IS SO ACTIVE IN THIS BORDER WITH MEXICO AND HOW SO MANY HIGH TECH RESEARCH IS DONE THERE. THIS MAY PROVIDE THEM ALSO GOOD CONNECTION FOR FUTURE JOBS. . IN ADDITION TO PROGRESS STUDENTS FROM THE 2-YEAR COLLEGE TO A 4 YEAR UNIVERSITY, THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT ONE GRADUATE STUDENT AND WILL CHANNEL ONE STUDENT TO DOCTORAL DEGREE.
GROW PROJECT

THE PURPOSE OF AUSTIN COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT'S (ACC) OPPORTUNITIES IN AGRICULTURE PROGRAM IS TO DEVELOP AN ASSOCIATE OF SCIENCE (AS) DEGREE PROGRAM IN AGRICULTURE AND AN ASSOCIATE OF APPLIED SCIENCES (AAS) DEGREE IN SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE TO INCREASE ACCESS TO AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES CAREERS FOR UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS IN CENTRAL TEXAS. THE AUDIENCE WILL BE UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS IN ACC'S SIX-COUNTY SERVICE AREA (METROPOLITAN AUSTIN, TEXAS AND SURROUNDING RURAL COMMUNITIES). DURING THE GRANT-FUNDED PERIOD, ACC ANTICIPATES SERVING 48 STUDENTS DIRECTLY THROUGH ENROLLMENT IN THE NEW COURSES, 25 DIRECTLY THROUGH SCHOLARSHIPS, 15 THROUGH STIPENDS, AND AN ADDITIONAL 50 STUDENTS DURING THE "AGRICULTURAL CAREER DAY" TO PROMOTE AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE CAREERS. ACC WILL WORK WITH FACULTY IN THE AGRICULTURE DEPARTMENTS OF REGIONAL UNIVERSITIES TO ENSURE THE NEW DEGREES ARE TRANSFERABLE TO A 4-YEAR INSTITUTION. COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS SERVING THE HISPANIC, AGRICULTURAL AND SUSTAINABLE FARMING COMMUNITIES WILL ADVISE ON THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROGRAM. OIA PRODUCTS WILL BE 42 HOURS OF COURSES IN UNDERGRADUATE AGRICULTURAL SCIENCE; APPROVED CURRICULUM AND TWO NEW DEGREE PROGRAMS IN AGRICULTURE (AS) AND SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE (AAS); CULTURALLY COMPETENT OUTREACH PLAN TO RECRUIT HISPANIC STUDENTS TO MAJOR IN THE AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES; AND ANNUAL REPORTS QUANTIFYING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PROJECT. THE RESULT OF THESE EFFORTS WILL BE AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS MAJORING IN AGRICULTURE AT ACC AND PURSUING AGRICULTURAL CAREERS.

WORLDWIDE, PLANT AND FOOD-BORNE PATHOGENS POSE SIGNIFICANT HAZARDS TO THE FOOD SUPPLY. AT THE UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO-MAYAGUEZ (UPRM) WE ARE CONSCIOUS OF THE IMPORTANCE OF PREPARING A ROBUST MASS OF HISPANIC SCIENTISTS WELL TRAINED TO DIAGNOSE PLANT DISEASES AND FOOD-BORNE PATHOGENS. THROUGH A MULTI-INSTITUTIONAL AND INTERDISCIPLINARY COLLABORATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN INTER AMERICAN UNIVERSITY-SAN GERMAN, PONTIFICAL CATHOLIC UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO-PONCE AND UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO-AGUADILLA, LEAD BY UPRM, WE WILL TRAIN AND EXPOSE A SUBSTANTIAL NUMBER OF UNDERREPRESENTED HISPANICS MINORITIES TO FOOD SECURITY AND FOOD SAFETY ISSUES. THIS COLLABORATIVE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE CURRICULA ENHANCEMENT, RESEARCH EXPERIENCES, INTERNSHIPS OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN USDA AGENCIES AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, AS WELL AS FACULTY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AMONG OTHERS. AND ONE PH.D., WILL BENEFIT FROM THE RESULTS OF THIS COLLABORATIVE AGREEMENT AMONG SCIENTISTS FROM ALL PARTICIPATING HSIS OF PUERTO RICO. OUR FINAL GOAL WILL BE TO INCREASE THE CRITICAL MASS OF HISPANIC AGRICULTURAL SCIENTISTS PURSUING CAREERS IN NIFA HIS PRIORITY AREAS OF FOOD SECURITY, FOOD SAFETY AND RELATED DISCIPLINES.
